translation.en: [Conor] All right, lads?
-[interviewer] What a scene. -[Conor laughs]
Yeah. This whole thing?
-With the ankle, like? -Yeah.
Maddest thing.
[interviewer] Yeah.
Only made that walk knowing something was going to happen to my ankle.
translation.ko: 거길 걸을 때 발목에 문제가 생길 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Like, I was testing it in the Octagon and I...
-I was stretching it. I was, like... -[crowd cheering]
First kick, I could feel it.
[commentator] Oh, no!
[interviewer] So, like, after the fact,
there was speculation that that was a career-ender.
-What I-- -I thought it was over as well.
I thought it was over as well, that's why I flipped into a different mode.
translation.ko: 제 생각도 그랬다고요 그래서 다른 모드를 켰죠

translation.en: This is not over!
If I have to take this outside with him, it's on outside.
translation.ko: 밖에서 해야 한다면 밖에서 하는 겁니다

translation.en: I don't give a bollocks!
Now, it was the adrenaline as well, and I know I would have calmed down.
translation.ko: 그때 아드레날린도 돌았고 진정할 거라는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: And, like, part of me is thinking, imagine if it was just taken from me like that.
translation.ko: 그런 생각도 있어요 저한테 그게 그렇게 없어진다면

translation.en: I would go into a different--
I would be a different person, and it was a bit scary, to be honest.
translation.ko: 나는 다른 사람이 되겠구나 솔직히 말해서 그건 조금 무서워요

translation.en: But...
It's McGregor forever.
-[siren blaring] -That's it.
Isn't it? Like it's done.
It's McGregor forever.
And don't you forget it. [chuckles]
[man 1] It's time to accept reality for McGregor fans
and, most importantly, for McGregor himself,
the McGregor show is over.
[man 2] Conor is damaged to the point that he is broken.
translation.ko: 이 시점에서 코너는 아주 심하게 망가졌습니다

translation.en: [man 3] I think that we have seen...
[man 4] His best days? I think those are over.
-[woman] Is Conor McGregor done? -[man 5] I think yes.
[man 6] He should be done based off of his leg.
[man 7] We'll probably never see Conor McGregor fight in the cage again.
translation.ko: 다시는 케이지에서 코너 맥그리거를 못 볼 겁니다

translation.en: [Conor] My name is Conor McGregor.
I'm a professional MMA fighter with a record of four and one.
[announcer] From Dublin, Ireland, here is Conor McGregor.
[Conor] I'm an up-and-coming fighter
and without a doubt, you will see me on the UFC in the near future.
translation.ko: 곧 UFC에서 절 보시게 될 거예요

translation.en: [commentator] McGregor with a huge shot!
Without a doubt.
[man 1] This is why everyone's been talking about Conor McGregor.
It's all over!
[man 2] Ultra-impressive UFC debut.
translation.ko: 끝났습니다! 대단한 UFC 데뷔군요! 〝나에게는 시작에 불과하다〞

translation.en: It's either all or nothing in the game I'm in.
translation.ko: 제가 하는 경기는 모 아니면 도죠

translation.en: [man 3] Conor McGregor is victorious.
We're not here just to take part, we're here to take over!
translation.ko: 참가하러 온 게 아니고 장악하러 온 겁니다

translation.en: It's all I think about. It's like an addiction for me.
translation.ko: 전 그 생각만 해요 중독 같은 거죠

translation.en: [man 4] Oh! Big shot from McGregor.
I don't want to do anything else, it's as simple as that.
translation.ko: 다른 건 하고 싶지 않아요 단순한 일이죠

translation.en: He's gonna come in, approach, and try and make the fight ugly.
translation.ko: 여기 와서 경기를 험악하게 만들 겁니다

translation.en: But as you can see, sitting here next to me, man,
-I'm just too damn pretty. -[audience laughs]
[Conor] The world title is next.
My dream is to be world lightweight champion in the UFC.
translation.ko: 제 꿈은 UFC의 라이트급 세계 챔피언입니다

translation.en: -Let's hope that counts. -Hey!
It will happen, and I'll let you know when it happens.
translation.ko: 그렇게 될 거예요 때가 되면 알려 드리죠

translation.en: [announcer] Conor McGregor is the new UFC featherweight champion!
translation.ko: 새로운 UFC 페더급 챔피언 코너 맥그리거입니다! 〝UFC의 새 얼굴〞

translation.en: Ireland, Baby, we did it! Yeah!
There's no one laughing at me now, I'll tell you that much.
translation.ko: 이젠 구급차 밖에서 비웃는 사람이 없어요

translation.en: You were richer than me the last time I came on this show.
translation.ko: 지난 번에 여기 나왔을 때 나한테 설교했죠?

translation.en: I will-- I will be where I wanna be.
translation.ko: 전 제가 원하는 대로 될 거예요

translation.en: I'm 100% confident of that, that I will make it to the top.
[man] History has been made.
Conor McGregor is the UFC lightweight champion.
The first man ever to hold two titles simultaneously.
translation.ko: 〝위대한 맥그리거〞 최초의 두 타이틀 동시 보유자입니다

translation.en: [Conor] My dream became reality.
Whoo! That looks good!
This is obviously a massive, massive accomplishment,
but at this stage of your career, what challenges you now?
translation.ko: 지금 이 상황에서 다음 도전은 뭔가요?

translation.en: [man 1] In combat sports, there's only two names at the top.
Floyd Mayweather and Conor McGregor.
For $100 million,
Conor will step into a boxing ring with Floyd Mayweather.
[man 2] The pay-off is huge, the hype couldn't be higher.
It'll be the biggest fight in the history of two people punching each other.
Just goes to show how hard work and dedication really does pay off.
translation.ko: 노력과 헌신의 결실이 얼마나 큰지 보여 드리죠

translation.en: [interviewer] But look at the bigness of it all.
Here you are, possibly the most famous Irish man on the planet.
translation.ko: 지구상에서 가장 유명한 아일랜드 사람일 겁니다

translation.en: My dream is to have more money than I know what to do with,
translation.ko: 어떻게 쓸지도 모를 만큼 많은 돈을 벌고

translation.en: and have a great life for everyone in my family,
translation.ko: 우리 가족 그리고 함께한 모든 사람과

translation.en: everyone that's come up with me.
[man 1] Conor has got $100 million in the bank. I think he's having fun.
translation.ko: 코너에겐 1억 달러가 있고 인생을 즐기고 있습니다

translation.en: -[man 1] Does he wanna fight? -[man 2] Better take the money and run.
translation.ko: - 더 싸우고 싶을까요? - 돈을 들고 튀어야죠

translation.en: -It ain't worth it! -Just ride off into the sunset, my friend.
[man 3] He's got a fucking $100 million. Money changes everything,
translation.ko: - 그럴 가치가 없어요 - 그냥 뛰어 코너에겐 1억 달러가 있다고요 〝악명〞 돈은 모든 걸 바꾸죠 코너는 다시는 싸우지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: so Conor might never fight again.
translation.ko: 돈은 모든 걸 바꾸죠 코너는 다시는 싸우지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: What's that? What's that?
-What's that? Yeah! -[cooing]
Go on. Hold on, hold on.
Look at him! That's him. That's him. Hup! Hup!
translation.ko: 이 녀석 좀 보게 바로 그거야

translation.en: Yay, champ!
That's insane, isn't it?
Did you see him hanging on the gymnastic rings?
I hold him, then guide him, he's, like, "Ah!"
It's like he did a pull-up, watch. Go on again, buddy. Go on.
translation.ko: 턱걸이를 해요 다시 해 보자, 얘야

translation.en: [Conor] Everything is just different with him.
translation.ko: 이 녀석이 있으니 모든 게 달라졌어요

translation.en: It only-- You don't know love like it until it's there, you can't even explain--
translation.ko: 이런 사랑은 없으면 알 수 없어요

translation.en: -Can't even think of it -[dog barking]
'cause it's non-existent, although it's not...
There's nothing like it.
Good boy.
Good boy.
Go on, champ! Let's go, champ!
-Let's go, champ! -[baby laughs]
He loves it, absolutely loves it, don't ya, buddy?
Know what else he loves? His cars.
translation.ko: 얘가 또 뭘 좋아하냐면 바로 차예요

translation.en: Yeah, buddy!
[Dee] What was he doing? Everything. Pull-ups, bag work.
-Oh, my God. -Rower.
The rower?
And then to and from the gym, in the Lambo.
translation.ko: 그러고는 람보를 몰고 체육관까지 갔다 왔어

translation.en: Yeah, buddy?
[Owen] I look back at what he's done, it was almost impossible.
translation.ko: 코너가 한 일을 돌아보면 거의 불가능한 일이에요

translation.en: To become the biggest superstar in the UFC.
When he's came from from a council estate
translation.ko: 〝타격 코치 오웬 로디 목소리〞 공영 주택 단지 출신으로

translation.en: where you do well to get out of the estate and get a half-decent job.
If you do that, you're doing better than 95% of the people
that are still in that situation.
[Conor] I come from a place in Dublin,
Dublin 12, it's a small suburb, it's very dear to my heart.
Crumlin's a tough area, it's just the way it was growing up but...
translation.ko: 크럼린은 거친 곳이에요 무슨 말인지 아시죠? 지금도 거긴 제가 어렸을 때와 판박이지만...

translation.en: It is where I learned the values of hard work,
where I learned loyalty, where I learned how to fight.
translation.ko: 충실함을 배웠고 싸우는 법을 배웠죠 〝크럼린 복싱 클럽〞

translation.en: In my home, like many other homes in Ireland,
the real stress and the real fights
come from the mortgage, come from the stress of home.
So that's something that I've grew up with.
There was a lot of stressful years, and a lot of tough times.
The Irish mentality is when you finish school,
there's no chasing your dreams and doing what you want to do,
translation.ko: 꿈을 쫓고 하고 싶은 걸 하는 대신

translation.en: it's get a trade or get in and do a job.
So I ended up getting a trade just to keep them quiet.
translation.ko: 그래서 저도 기술을 배웠어요 입방아에 안 오르려고요

translation.en: I ended up getting a trade as a plumber.
I spent 18 months doing that.
I was, like, "This isn't for me. This is not for me."
Then focused on training.
In Ireland, no one knew what the fuck MMA was, know what I mean?
No one knew. "What, that's the boxing in the cage?"
Or, you know, "What is this?"
Me Ma and Da, they didn't know I could make a career out of it.
translation.ko: 부모님은 이게 돈벌이가 된다는 걸 몰랐어요

translation.en: As far as they were concerned, I was just getting into a cage,
translation.ko: 부모님이 보기엔 케이지에 들어가서 싸우는 거였죠

translation.en: and fighting some other guy. They didn't know nothing about it.
translation.ko: 케이지에 들어가서 싸우는 거였죠 아무것도 모르셨어요

translation.en: I couldn't go to people and say I want to follow this guy's career
because there was no path for us, you know what I mean?
But I knew what was gonna happen, I knew I was gonna get here.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 이렇게 될 줄 알았어요

translation.en: What way do I do this, Dee?
What comes out of it? What comes out of it?
-Confetti, the same stuff that's... -Ah, right.
Yeah, but will it just fall or will it rise?
No, it's gonna explode!
[all] Three, two, one...
Ah, stop that.
Baby, I'm delighted... Oh, my God!
A sister, buddy.
-[Dee] Shitting it now, are you? -[Conor] Little sister! [laughs]
Ah, stop, man! [laughs]
I wanted a sparring partner, but fuck it.
What's the baby?
Oh, my God, man. I can't believe it, a daughter.
Oh, I am delighted!
[Owen] He's become a family man now
and his main focus is on, you know, raising his kids.
As you become a father, you start to realize
that eventually, you know, the fighting will end.
The fighter has to weigh up the pros and cons of doing it.
Most people fight to get out of the financial burdens they're going through.
And Conor done that.
You know, most normal people would be, like,
"Right, I've made all my money. There's no real need to fight again."
translation.ko: 돈을 많이 벌었으니 싸울 이유가 없다고요

translation.en: But I think the difference with Conor is,
translation.ko: 돈을 많이 벌었으니 싸울 이유가 없다고요 하지만 코너가 다른 점은

translation.en: Conor wants to prove it, more so to himself,
translation.ko: 자신이 지구상에서 가장 강한 사람이란 걸

translation.en: that he's the baddest man on the planet.
And then, you know, there was talk, you know what I mean?
This lad Khabib is going through everybody and he's been calling you out.
translation.ko: 모두랑 붙는 하빕이라는 친구가 코너도 불러내고 있어요

translation.en: The thing with Conor is, he's not going to shy away from any fight.
-No matter who it is. -[crowd cheering]
[announcer] Khabib "The Eagle" Nurmagomedov.
[Ariel] Khabib Nurmagomedov was an unbelievable prospect
translation.ko: UFC에 입성할 때의 하빕 누르마고메도프는 〝MMA 기자 아리엘 헬와니 목소리〞

translation.en: when he entered the UFC.
translation.ko: 〝MMA 기자 아리엘 헬와니 목소리〞 엄청난 유망주였어요

translation.en: You don't see a lot of guys come into the UFC 16-0.
But then he continues to climb, 18-0, 19-0,
The guy wasn't losing fights, he wasn't losing rounds,
translation.ko: 경기는 물론이고 한 라운드도 지지 않았고

translation.en: he wasn't losing minutes, he wasn't losing anything.
[Conor] Let's go. Let's go. Let's go.
[John] If you're in the MMA world at all,
Khabib was known, clearly had a very, very difficult style to deal with.
There's that picture of Conor and Khabib after a fight.
translation.ko: 경기 후 코너와 하빕이 찍은 사진이 있어요

translation.en: They're both telling each other they like each other's style,
translation.ko: 서로 상대방 스타일이 마음에 든다고 하죠

translation.en: "Oh, let's train together..."
I kinda laugh looking back at how that turned out.
[Dana] This is a mean business we're in
and some of these guys that fight for a living
are not wired the way the rest of the world is.
It's all about respect. If you get disrespected,
shit gets bad.
[interviewer] Khabib, there was an incident with Artem Lobov,
Conor's teammate.
Can you comment on what happened during that incident?
[in Russian] One is a champion who shows up no matter what,
translation.ko: 한쪽은 무슨 일이 있든지 나타나는 챔피언이고

translation.en: the other is a pussy who will pull out every time.
-[in English] You called me a pussy... -[man] Artem and Khabib. didn't you?
[Dana] Khabib felt the need to grab Artem, slap him...
Nothing happened.
[Dana] Which then led Conor to grab a bunch of guys
and then attack that bus that night.
[Dana] You've got two young, testosterone-filled guys,
translation.ko: 젊고 공격적인 사람이 두 명 있지만

translation.en: but you can never really prepare
for when all hell's gonna break loose.
[man] Holy shit!
Professional fighter Conor McGregor now has a court battle on his hands.
translation.ko: 프로 파이터인 맥그리거가 법정에 서게 됐습니다

translation.en: [reporter] McGregor's been charged with three counts of assault
and one count of criminal felony mischief.
[photographer] Conor, can you deal with your little temper tantrums?
translation.ko: 코너, 당신 울화통은 조절 안 됩니까?

translation.en: [reporter] The 30-year-old Irish fighter pleaded guilty to the reduced charge
translation.ko: 30세의 아일랜드 선수는 치안 문란 행위로 낮춘 기소에

translation.en: of disorderly conduct in exchange for community service.
translation.ko: 유죄를 인정하고 사회 봉사를 하게 됐습니다

translation.en: Here he comes.
I just wanna say, I'm thankful to the DA and the judge
for allowing me to move forward. I wanna say to my friends,
translation.ko: 기회를 주신 것에 감사합니다 친구들과 가족

translation.en: my family, my fans,
-thank you for the support. -[fan] Let's go, Conor!
[Ariel] Ariel Helwani, in Brooklyn alongside Conor McGregor's manager, Audie Attar.
translation.ko: 코너 맥그리거의 매니저인 오디 아타르와 함께 있습니다

translation.en: Audie, the hearing just wrapped up, you accepted a plea deal.
translation.ko: 오디, 공판이 끝났는데 유죄를 인정했죠 형량 거래가 만족스럽나요?

translation.en: Are you guys happy with the plea deal?
We're very satisfied and very thankful to the courts,
and happy to put this behind us,
and focus on things that have been on hold for some time now
translation.ko: 오랫동안 진행된 일에 집중하고 본업에 복귀할 수 있게 되어

translation.en: and get back to business.
[Ariel] Everyone wants to know when he's going to return.
[Audie] Conor's been training, he's in great shape right now.
He's ready to take this next challenge on.
[Ariel] Will the opponent be Khabib Nurmagomedov, whenever he returns?
[Audie] I think that's the likely opponent. We'll see how the negotiations go.
translation.ko: 그럴 가능성이 큰데 협상이 어떻게 될지 지켜봐야죠

translation.en: [Ariel] Everyone was very well aware that
if the UFC is able to figure out a way
to book Khabib, who was just so dominant,
the guy's 25-0, against Conor,
who is the biggest star in mixed martial arts,
this would be, without a doubt, the biggest fight in UFC history.
translation.ko: 그건 UFC 역사상 최고의 경기가 될 겁니다

translation.en: There would be no question about it.
The feud was so bitter, there was so much bad blood,
translation.ko: 반목이 너무 심하고 서로 굉장한 앙숙이라

translation.en: at that point, it felt like almost destiny.
[Dana] That's it? No more questions?
We have one more thing we wanna show you.
translation.ko: 보여 드릴 게 하나 더 있습니다

translation.en: [Khabib] We have to finish this.
Let's go. I'm ready for this.
[announcer] Two destroyers, two outstanding fighters.
translation.ko: 두 명의 파괴자 두 명의 탁월한 파이터

translation.en: This is the fight that everybody wants to see.
[Dana] It will be massive.
[Conor] Surprise, surprise. The king is back.
[Dana] The fight is done.
-October, Las Vegas. -[cheers and applause]
-It's on, ladies and gentlemen. -[cheering intensifies]
They announced the fight.
This right here is what everybody's been waiting for.
This fight is about to be the best fight in the UFC, bro.
The biggest fight in the history of the UFC.
Conor hasn't fought in two years and now, all of a sudden,
maybe the biggest fight in UFC history.
translation.ko: 갑자기 UFC 사상 최고의 경기를 벌이네요

translation.en: You have two guys who truly hate each other.
There's a lot of bad blood there.
There's more on the line than just win or lose.
translation.ko: 승패 외에도 많은 게 걸려 있죠

translation.en: It's gotten bigger than just a UFC fight.
I think this is the fight of his life.
[John] Preparing to fight Khabib,
he's quite unique in how he does things.
He has that very aggressive submission game.
Khabib has said himself
that if you defend 99 takedowns, I'll get the 100th takedown.
It's hard to beat someone who is never gonna stop trying that tactic,
translation.ko: 그런 전략을 계속 쓰는 선수는 쓰러뜨리기 힘들어요

translation.en: just keep smashing and smashing it until he's successful with it.
So a lot of the training was in preparation for that.
translation.ko: 그래서 그걸 대비하는 훈련을 많이 했어요

translation.en: Give us a round today, yeah?
-You? Yeah? -Yeah. Me and you.
No... That guy?
No, no.
Not yet. Maybe tomorrow.
translation.ko: 아직은 아니고 아마 내일 할 거야

translation.en: -Ah, me? Ah! -Yeah, yeah.
Okay.
[John] The build-up to the Khabib fight was different than anything
we'd been through before.
Very dark, very negative.
Lot of the training was Conor just, kind of,
-wanting to come in and fight people. -Nice.
Conor didn't really want to drill with the guy, or train with the guy.
He just wanted to come in and beat the guy.
Break! Good work.
[John] This specific training camp was almost, um, ominous.
Too much.
My toes are broken. [exhales]
What is it?
On the takedown?
-Like, right here, or back here? -Yeah, it's broke.
-It's here. -Oh, okay.
-Might be a dislocation. -It's not. It's bad.
translation.ko: - 탈구일 수도 있어 - 아니야, 상태가 안 좋아

translation.en: -Okay. -Fuck's sake!
That's bad, is it?
Why's it like that? It's like it's locked more than anything.
translation.ko: 왜 그러지? 제대로 고정한 것 같은데

translation.en: It's spasming.
-Yeah. -Might be dislocated.
[Julian] The sooner, the faster we put it back then the less...
-That's what I'm saying. -Quick! Quick!
What you have to-- what you gotta do is you gotta relax.
[Julian] You ready?
Argh. No, no, no.
-The sooner we do it. -Fuck's sake!
No, it's not that bad.
[Conor] Oh, bollocks, that's the whole toe's bent.
[man] What's the window to get this done, if he doesn't do it now?
translation.ko: 지금 바로 안 하면 언제까지 해야 하지?

translation.en: [Julian] The quicker you do it, the less damage...
[man] Well, we're gonna sit down.
-[cries] -This is gonna hurt, right?
[Julian] D'you want to do it or not?
Tell me when you're ready and you wanna do it.
You tried to do it and you couldn't do it!
translation.ko: 해 봤지만 못 한 거 아냐?

translation.en: [Julian] Well, I have to pull on it a bit more.
-[man] Do it. -Come on.
[Julian] I'm just going to stretch it first. Try not to resist it.
translation.ko: 먼저 펴야 돼 힘 주지 마

translation.en: -Argh! Yeah, there we go. -It's done.
Ah, that was easy. That was light work.
That was light work.
-Relax, relax-- -The other one's all right.
-The other one's all right. -It's on top.
Not gonna hurt you.
That was nothing.
It wasn't, it was a nightmare.
I feel I could do the rounds again.
That's right!
We wanna bring the swelling down, right?
Just-- just leave him for today.
In a few days, it'll be fine.
It popped in smooth, right?
And I think that it'll be tender for the next few days,
but it's not a disaster. In a week's time, no problem.
translation.ko: 큰 문제는 아니야 일주일이면 문제없을 거야

translation.en: -[man] Listen. -No.
-It's a positive thing, it's not broken. -Yeah.
-It's all right? -Feels okay.
-Feels fine. -Whole way round?
-It feels like-- A couple of toes. -Anywhere round here?
I've fucked up my ligaments, nine days before, in my knee.
Before fights. It's a couple of toes.
translation.ko: 경기 전에 말이야 지금은 고작 발가락 몇 개야

translation.en: I'll still smack him in.
[man 1] Conor McGregor and Khabib Nurmagomedov
translation.ko: 〝맥그리거 대 하빕 경기 16일 전〞 코너 맥그리거와 하빕 누르마고메도프가

translation.en: face to face, one of the most anticipated, if not the most anticipated,
translation.ko: 코너 맥그리거와 하빕 누르마고메도프가 UFC 역사상 최고로 기대되는 기자 회견에서

translation.en: press conferences in UFC history.
[man 2] How concerned should everyone be about Conor McGregor,
considering the fact that he's been away for a couple of years?
[man 3] Khabib is 26-0, which is almost impossible to do in this sport.
This is a massive fight for Conor McGregor.
He takes a two year layoff
and comes right after the biggest, nastiest dude in the world right now.
translation.ko: 현재 세계 최강의 상대를 지금 여기서 만나려고 합니다

translation.en: [Dana] What's up, everybody? Thanks for coming.
Who has the first question?
For Conor, what was the process to get you back in the Octagon
translation.ko: 코너, 옥타곤에 돌아온 경위와 이 경기를 택한 이유를

translation.en: and why was it this particular fight?
I came back for the love of this.
To come and shut this man up. A little rat. A little weasel.
translation.ko: 거기다 쥐새끼에 족제비 같은 이 친구도 잠재우고요

translation.en: And that's it. I came back for the love of fighting,
and the love of war, and this I am going to truly, truly love
translation.ko: 전쟁이 좋아서 온 거예요 이 유리턱 쥐새끼에게

translation.en: putting a bad, bad beating on this little glass-jaw rat.
Khabib, do you have any response?
This is everything what I expect.
In terms of what? What did you expect?
I'm come here for smash this guy.
-I don't wanna talk-- -Smash me, mate! Smash me!
Here, smash me! I'm right in front of you.
translation.ko: 눕혀 보라고! 난 네가 안 무서워

translation.en: Did you not see me outside the bus, no?
translation.ko: 버스 밖에서 날 본 적이 없잖아?

translation.en: You talked a big game. Now I'm here.
translation.ko: 큰 경기를 원해? 이제 내가 나왔다

translation.en: He done fucking nothing. He sat and took a shit on that bus.
translation.ko: 이놈은 한 게 없어요 버스 안에 틀어박혀만 있었지

translation.en: Here's my location, you little fool!
Right in front of you! Do something about it!
translation.ko: 바로 네 앞에 있으니 뭐든 해 봐!

translation.en: Do something about it! Yeah, you'll do nothing.
Khabib, when you're fighting Conor, you're just not fighting Conor,
translation.ko: 하빕, 코너와 싸울 땐 코너와만 싸우는 게 아녜요

translation.en: Conor brings, well, a fan base.
-You know-- -It's Shite-In-The-Bus' birthday!
Here's a gargle for you, Dana. Proper 12.
I am not underestimate this guy. I think it's gonna be long night for him.
translation.ko: 낮게 평가하진 않습니다 저 친구에겐 긴 밤이 되겠죠

translation.en: -Ah, yes! -It's gonna be long night for him.
translation.ko: - 아, 그래! - 긴 밤이 될 겁니다

translation.en: -Oh, Lord, save me... -He know this.
translation.ko: - 주님, 살려 주세요 - 자기도 그걸 알아요

translation.en: His blood will be on the canvas. October 6th.
Let's get this face-off done, we're wrapped up now.
-Thank you everyone, let's go. -[audience clapping]
Let's get face-to-face, let's get close, look into the eyes.
-Yeah? -Don't touch each other, please.
Get me to me car, I'm outta here.
Get me to me car.
I can see blue lips. Blue lips.
That's enough. That's enough.
Your wrestling is zero, your grappling is zero.
-Stall it down! -I'm gonna maul you.
Let's wrestle, kid. Bring it, kid. Wanna bet?
translation.ko: 붙어 보자, 이 자식아! 어디 해 봅시다 내기할래요?

translation.en: -[Khabib] I'm gonna put him back to box. -[Conor] Ma-ma-ma-ma.
-I'm going to put him to box. -Fuck you!
Don't come at the king!
[man 1] That was a very dark press conference.
[man 2] It was the darkest conference I've ever been a part of.
translation.ko: 제가 참여한 회견 중 가장 암울했습니다

translation.en: [man 3] It's like a movie. It's like when the king goes mad.
translation.ko: 영화 같았어요 왕이 미쳐 날뛰는 것 같았죠

translation.en: Those stories never end well for the king.
translation.ko: 이런 이야기에서 왕은 좋게 끝나지 않아요

translation.en: [man 4] A bit unhinged between McGregor and Khabib.
[woman] These two obviously don't like each other.
translation.ko: 맥그리거와 하빕 간에는 문제가 많았습니다 넘지 못할 선이 없는 것 같습니다

translation.en: [man 5] There's no line that they won't cross. None. Zero.
translation.ko: 넘지 못할 선이 없는 것 같습니다

translation.en: [man 6] ...different than any other situation I've ever been in,
not just with Conor but with any fighter.
-[car honks] -♪ Whoomp, there it is ♪ ♪ Whoomp, there it is ♪
translation.ko: 탕! 저기 있네 탕! 저기 있네

translation.en: Yeah, welcome.
-It's stayed there with additional care. -How tender are you when I touch it?
That's-- Yeah, it's tender.
That's sore as well.
I don't feel any chips and stuff when I come through the joint, which is great.
translation.ko: 관절에 조각 같은 건 없어요 좋은 일이죠

translation.en: But while you're here the next few weeks,
we'll work and get all the fluid out of it.
Whenever you can train in shoes and it's not going to affect you,
-I would do so, just to keep it... -Okay.
...so you can't catch it and really, like, flop it out more.
Go!
Today, we're just doing worst-case scenario, you can't throw punches.
translation.ko: 오늘은 레슬링 연습이라 주먹을 쓰면 안 돼요

translation.en: Him starting on his back and then having me on top.
translation.ko: 코너가 바닥에 눕고 제가 위에 있죠

translation.en: When he's there in the fight, he's gonna know he's been there before.
translation.ko: 코너는 이전에도 이걸 해 본 것 같아요

translation.en: It makes a big difference.
-And time. -All right!
Good work out. Well done, well done.
[Conor] In that last one, I put many of my tools into the toolbox
translation.ko: 지난 번에는 많은 도구를 상자에 넣고

translation.en: and left them there when I stepped into that boxing ring.
translation.ko: 그걸 거기에 내버려 둔 채 복싱 링에 나왔죠

translation.en: So I think many people forget the skills I possess,
translation.ko: 제가 가진 기술을 잊은 사람들이 많을 거예요

translation.en: and I look forward to going back out, proving, once again,
translation.ko: 이제 그걸 다시 끄집어내 모든 체급을 통틀어

translation.en: that I am the pound-for-pound number one fighter on the planet.
translation.ko: 제가 지구상에서 최고라는 걸 입증할 겁니다

translation.en: [Owen] We were limited to just our hands in the last fight,
translation.ko: 지난 번 경기에서는 손만 쓸 수 있었는데

translation.en: but now he's able to use all the tools, you can see that in the spars and stuff.
translation.ko: 이번에는 모든 걸 쓸 수 있죠 스파링도 그렇게 하고 있고요

translation.en: He's very creative, he's using all the weapons,
translation.ko: 코너는 아주 창의적으로 가진 무기를 다 써요

translation.en: and he looks phenomenal.
It's definitely getting closer, though, look.
Look how closer it's getting to the other one.
-It's way better. -It's not separating anymore.
[Owen] Conor will always go in to kill, you know what I mean?
translation.ko: 코너는 언제나 죽이려고 해요 무슨 말인지 알죠?

translation.en: But this one just got a little bit more personal,
translation.ko: 하지만 이건 조금 개인 감정이 섞였어요

translation.en: so he could feel that there was a lot of real bad blood there.
The whole energy of the camp was different.
There was more tension.
Did you see the picture of side by side me and him at UFC 205?
translation.ko: UFC 205에서 같이 서 있는 거 봤어?

translation.en: Look at the state of him.
Little scrawny yoke, he is.
He's a twerp he is, I'll dance on his head.
[Colin] He had a dream in his life, to become something.
translation.ko: 코너에겐 뭔가 되겠다는 평생의 꿈이 있었어요

translation.en: Got to be the champion, and then it came with all the other shit.
translation.ko: 그렇게 챔피언이 됐더니 많은 게 따라왔죠

translation.en: That distraction, it pulls you, it pulls you, it pulls you,
translation.ko: 그런 다른 것들 때문에 발목이 계속 잡혀서

translation.en: away from what you're wanting to do in the first place.
translation.ko: 가장 하고 싶은 걸 못 하게 됐고요

translation.en: What I see with him right now is a return to himself.
[Conor] I fell out of love with the game for a bit.
The situation arose with this next opponent
and I just became a lot more hungry
to come back and show who the real king is.
-[machine whirring] -Yeah, that's way better. -Way better? Yeah. -Yeah.
If we stay on that, honestly, in the next week.
-It'll be brand new. -Yeah, you'll be--
Wow! It's actually way better!
-Feels like it's gone. -[laughs]
[Julian] All things considered, things are going well.
A few little injuries, a few little naggling pains,
translation.ko: 잔부상 몇 개와 통증이 조금 있지만

translation.en: but they're now under control, so...
At this point, the training's pretty much been completed.
Uh, we're just in the taper phase, just to keep him loosened out.
translation.ko: 이젠 훈련량을 줄이면서 긴장을 푸는 단계예요

translation.en: [Conor] I'm just visualizing positions, situations
translation.ko: 경기에 나오는 상황을 머릿속에 그리려고 해요

translation.en: that may present themselves in the fight, and just enjoying being in my thoughts.
translation.ko: 경기에 나오는 상황을 머릿속에 그리려고 해요 그 생각을 즐기고요

translation.en: [man] We saw you comfortable in the role of a villain,
but tonight, you'll be the hero.
Is there either role you find suits you better?
I'm not playing a role.
Every crowd has a different energy.
Every place has a different energy.
I just feed off the energy, and whatever that energy is, it is.
translation.ko: 전 그 에너지가 뭐든 간에 섭취할 뿐이에요

translation.en: I always hear them saying it's a sell.
To sell a fight. I'm not trying to sell nothing.
translation.ko: 싸움을 판다고요 전 아무것도 안 팝니다

translation.en: I'm trying to kill 'em, and that's it.
This is the way it is. It's not a joke, it's not an act.
I'm here to take what's mine.
[announcer] The notorious one is in the building.
translation.ko: 악명 높은 인물이 이 건물에 들어섰습니다

translation.en: He's returning to the Octagon on Saturday night. Please give him a warm welcome,
translation.ko: 토요일에 복귀할 예정이니 열렬히 맞아 주세요

translation.en: the notorious Conor McGregor.
-[Conor] What's up, Las Vegas? -[crowd cheering]
I'm coming for that man's head from the fucking bell!
translation.ko: 놈의 머리를 가지러 왔습니다 그건 틀림없습니다 제 말 믿으시죠!

translation.en: Trust me on that!
UFC 229 is finally here.
Conor McGregor's long-awaited, much-anticipated return to the Octagon...
translation.ko: 오랫동안 기다리고 기대해 온 코너 맥그리거의 복귀...

translation.en: We have no clue which Conor McGregor's going to show up.
translation.ko: 코너가 무엇을 보여 줄지 전혀 모르겠군요

translation.en: [man] Conor is the most famous guy in the Octagon.
Is he the best fighter?
Let's go! It's over! Round 1! One round!
[reporter] Who d'you think'll win the fight?
-Odds are in Conor's favor. -Khabib can kick his ass.
Khabib's wrestling is just a level above everybody else.
Conor's just got that left hand, he's fast...
I think it's an even fight, to be honest.
[Dana] All right! This is awkward.
Khabib said he's not gonna wait, he wants to start the press conference without him.
Hey, I no need wait for nobody.
3:00 p.m., I begin. If you guys have question, let's go.
Win or lose, will you shake Conor's hand after the fight?
translation.ko: 이기든 지든 경기 후에 악수할 겁니까?

translation.en: No way. No way.
[reporter] Why not?
[Khabib] For me, this is more than defend my title,
translation.ko: 제게 이번 경기는 단순한 타이틀 방어전 이상의

translation.en: more than main event. You know, for me, it's personal.
Fifteen minute I am here.
This guy didn't come. This is big disrespect.
See you tomorrow, guys.
[host] Was this a conscious decision? Maybe a little bit of a mind game?
[Conor] He knew what he fucking signed up for.
translation.ko: 놈은 이게 어떤 경기인지 잘 압니다

translation.en: The traffic is a little heavy, there must be a McGregor fight going on.
I don't know where the little fool is.
I don't give a fuck about him.
I plan on knocking that man's nose straight into the nosebleeds.
translation.ko: 놈의 코를 가격해 코피를 터뜨릴 겁니다

translation.en: That's what's gonna happen on Saturday night.
Now, there's no doubt this has been
translation.ko: UFC 경기에서 이렇게 분위기가 고조되는 건

translation.en: one of the most exciting build-ups we've ever seen for a UFC fight.
translation.ko: UFC 경기에서 이렇게 분위기가 고조되는 건 틀림없이 처음일 겁니다

translation.en: [reporter] Do you think the presence of all these Irish fans has kind of gotten to him mentally?
translation.ko: 아일랜드 팬이 이렇게 많은 게 하빕에게 영향이 있을까요?

translation.en: Fuck him and his mentality.
[Conor] My heart is black towards this man.
Towards his team. Towards his people.
[announcer] The notorious... Conor McGregor!
[interviewer] Do you see yourself being able to squash the beef after fighting him?
[Conor] Fuck peace! There will never be peace here.
translation.ko: 평화 같은 소리! 여긴 평화가 없어요

translation.en: And this is never over. Never, ever, ever over!
translation.ko: 이건 무슨 일이 있더라고 절대 끝나지 않을 겁니다!

translation.en: -Bye! -Wanna go vroom-vroom?
-Do you wanna go with them? -Yes.
[Owen] In the lead-up to the fight, I've never really seen that kinda hate
translation.ko: 이 경기를 준비하면서 코너가 이렇게 증오하는 건

translation.en: from Conor before.
But on the night, everything that goes before it,
translation.ko: 하지만 이 날 밤엔 문이 닫히고 나면

translation.en: once the door closes, you know, it's just him and him in there.
[Conor] I've spent my entire life's work
to win those two UFC world titles.
There's a lot of people talking some stuff, that's great,
because that's the beautiful thing about this game.
We say whatever we want but, at the end of the day,
translation.ko: 뭐든 말하라고 하세요 하지만 결국 중요한 건

translation.en: we've gotta fight and that's a beautiful thing.
translation.ko: 싸워야 한다는 거죠 그게 멋진 점이에요

translation.en: [woman] One minute!
-Let's do it... -Yes.
[Conor] I feel confident going against any man.
As Chael P. said, any man God made, know what I mean?
translation.ko: 채얼 P. 소넌 말대로 신이 만든 모든 사람요

translation.en: Not only that, I'll whoop God as well, help me so.
I'm ready for anyone in the division at any given time.
I'm trouble for them all.
Five, four, three,
two, one, go, go, go!
[announcer] Fighting out of the blue corner...
the notorious Conor McGregor!
Fighting out of the red corner,
presenting the reigning champion of the world,
Khabib...
"The Eagle" Nurmagomedov!
And now...
this is the moment you've truly all been waiting for.
Here... it... comes!
All right, gentlemen. We've been over the rules.
Protect yourself at all times. Follow my instructions.
translation.ko: 항상 자신을 보호하고 내 지시를 따라요

translation.en: We're gonna keep this clean. Touch gloves now if you wish to.
All right. Let's do this.
Fight!
[commentator 1] Pressure right off that bat by Conor.
He's trying to force the shot out of Khabib with pressure.
translation.ko: 하빕에게 압박을 가하며 공격을 날리려고 합니다

translation.en: Okay, bend the legs, bend the legs!
[commentator 2] He's doing a fantastic job of defending.
Conor gets right up to the cage.
Let's see if he can get back up. This is one of the big questions.
Twenty seconds! Twenty seconds!
[commentator 1] Couple of right hands have landed for Khabib,
-his first strikes of the fight. -[referee] Stop!
Perfect.
You know the shots get slower as the rounds go on.

translation.en: That was his absolute best there.
You're gonna get looser as the fight goes on.
That's your game.
[commentator 1] Well, every mixed martial arts round begins on the feet.

translation.en: Let's see how it goes here early round 2.
McGregor fires the knee, appeared to just miss.
translation.ko: 맥그리거가 니킥을 날렸지만 빗맞은 것 같습니다

translation.en: [commentator 2] Oh! Massive right from Nurmagomedov!
And a knee from McGregor now!
-[commentator 1] Nasty right hand. -[commentator 2] Wow.
[commentator 1] What an entry by Nurmagomedov.
Oh! Conor's getting lit up.
Conor's in serious, serious trouble.
[commentator 2] McGregor forced to just cover up.
Get off your side!
[commentator 2] How many shots can one man take?
One minute! One minute, Conor!
Crowd goes bananas as McGregor gets up.
Yes! Keep the grip!
[commentator 2] Nurmagomedov with a huge second round,
likely a 10-8.
Do not chase him this round. Draw him on.
If you push him back, you can spend the first minute just getting your recovery.

translation.en: [commentator 1] Kavanaugh said we can get a little air
if you pressure in the beginning.
And now Khabib's tired, too, don't forget that.

translation.en: [commentator 2] You hate to read too much into the body language

translation.en: but this is as fatigued as I've seen Khabib Nurmagomedov in that Octagon.
[commentator 1] There's the shot.
[commentator 2] That's what they were talking about.
[commentator 1] He stopped that one. Oh, elbow by Conor!
Yes!
[commentator 1] Level change from Khabib.
[commentator 2] He stops that as well. Look at this.
Break! Break away!
[commentator 2] Nice knee to the body by Conor.
[commentator 1] Those knees to the body will add up.
Oh! Uppercut.
These guys are staring each other in the face.
No range at all. They're just sitting there punching, exchanging.

Two-on-one. Keep the hands away!

[referee] Hey, stop. Stop.
[announcer] Fifteen minutes in the books. We head to the championship rounds.
[commentator 2] Conor looks very good coming out for this fourth round.
[commentator 1] Good entry by Nurmagomedov.
McGregor trying to use the fence to his advantage.
And he gets tripped right down. Too good.
[commentator 2] But Conor's back up to his feet, almost.
[commentator 1] Big left hands from Nurmagomedov.
translation.ko: 누르마고메도프의 강한 레프트가 여러 번 들어갑니다

translation.en: -[commentator 2] There's the tap! -[commentator 1] He's out!
[commentator 2] Still undisputed!
Khabib Nurmagomedov has finished Conor McGregor tonight.
translation.ko: 하빕 누르마고메도프가 오늘 밤 코너 맥그리거를 끝장냈습니다!

translation.en: [commentator 1] Look at him. He's screaming at Dillon Danis.
translation.ko: 하빕 좀 보세요 딜런 대니스에게 소리칩니다

translation.en: Look at him.
Oh, no, no, no.
[commentator 2] And now Khabib jumps the fence. Wow!
And he's going right at Dillon Danis.
Mayhem! Oh, no!
Total chaos here! Oh!
And now one of Nurmagomedov's teammates throws a right hand at Conor.
All hell has broken loose!
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, referee Herb Dean
translation.ko: 신사 숙녀 여러분 허브 딘 심판이

translation.en: has called a stop to this contest at three minutes, three seconds
of a fourth round.
...by submission, due to a rear naked choke
and still...
The undisputed UFC
lightweight champion of the world...
Khabib
"The Eagle"
Nurmagomedov!
I'm proud of you. I'm proud of you.
[Dana] How are you? Are you all right?
I mean, after the shots you took when the kid jumped in.
-Don't give a fuck about that. -Huh?
I don't give a bollocks about that, that was handbags.
translation.ko: 신경 안 씁니다 별로 중요한 게 아니니까요

translation.en: I didn't see Khabib jumping over. I didn't see that coming.
translation.ko: 하빕이 펜스를 넘을 줄은 상상도 못 했어

translation.en: [Conor] Who cares about that? That's handbags.
I was beat, and that's that.
I was beat where it mattered, and that's it.
End of. Who cares about any of the other shit?
All right. If you need anything, let me know, okay?
Thank you.
[Colin] The Khabib fight was a kick in the hole.
And he deserved it.
There's nothing nice about any of that.
All that anger, and the press conference,
the incident after the fight,
there's no winners in any of that, it's just all hate.
It brought out the worst in both of them, as humans, you know?
translation.ko: 두 사람은 인간으로서 최악의 모습을 보여 줬고요

translation.en: And it takes away from what it's meant to be.
But at this stage, it's not really about winning or losing anymore.
The fighting is a very small part of it.
It's really only something we do for 10 minutes.
It's the rest of the months, weeks, years,
translation.ko: 중요한 건 남은 달, 주 남은 해예요

translation.en: that-- It's not really about fighting,
it's about what he can do as a force in the world.
He's got a platform to do great or do bad.
translation.ko: 코너에겐 훌륭하게 되거나 나쁘게 될 발판이 있어요

translation.en: [reporter] Conor McGregor was charged in a Brooklyn court today
for a violent attack on a busload of other fighters.
[reporter 2] The 30-year-old Irish fighter
pleaded guilty to the reduced charge of disorderly conduct
translation.ko: 치안 문란 행위로 낮춘 기소에 유죄를 인정하고

translation.en: in exchange for five days of community service.
[Colin] There is a little bit of push and pull for him,
and anybody that ever gets to that level of pressure.
You know, with the fire, do you cook the steak or d'you set fire to the house?
translation.ko: 불이 있다면 고기를 구울까요? 집에 불을 낼까요?

translation.en: [clears throat] Today is me first day of community service
translation.ko: 아름다운 뉴욕 브루클린에서 사회 봉사를 하는

translation.en: here in beautiful Brooklyn, New York.
translation.ko: 아름다운 뉴욕 브루클린에서 사회 봉사를 하는 첫날입니다

translation.en: Bedford Presbyterian Church.
"Glory to God in the highest...
and on Earth peace good-will toward men."
Wow, very cool, very cool.
Good start to the community service.
-Isn't it? -Yeah, giving a little bit back.
translation.ko: - 안 그래? - 그래, 받은 걸 돌려줘야지

translation.en: [interviewer] You've become a role model to a lot of, sort of,
younger, up-and-coming fighters.
How important is that to you and does that help you become
a better fighter knowing that these guys look up to you?
translation.ko: 최고의 파이터가 되는 데 그걸 아는 게 도움이 되나요?

translation.en: That's brilliant. Of course, it's uplifting to me.
It's inspiring but at the same time, it's a little scary.
translation.ko: 좋은 영감을 받지만 조금 무섭기도 해요

translation.en: It's a little bit scary that people...
Like a role model kinda shit. I don't think I'm that kinda guy.
translation.ko: 전 본보기가 될 만한 그런 사람이 아니거든요

translation.en: 'Cause I'm only 25, I'm only a little kid from a small estate in Crumlin, so,
to be here, and all this going on,
sometimes it's a bit overwhelming, know what I mean?
[Audie] He still has a lot more growth to be had.
And the difference between him and the rest of the world is that
he has to do it all on display for everybody to watch.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들이 볼 수 있도록 이 모든 걸 해야 한다는 거죠

translation.en: The failures, the shortcomings,
the embarrassments,
you have to take all that on
in order to continue to evolve and move forward,
and if you don't, it's gonna keep getting harder,
and you're not gonna get better.
Look at the things it says around here. Look at this.
"Focus on the hard times ahead
with thoughts of those who came before you.
Focus on the mission ahead and thoughts of your role
as a leader in your community.
Focus on the obligations of your family..."
Heya, champion.
"...with thoughts of their needs first."
She's eight weeks tomorrow? Two months?
Yeah.
Yeah, and now look, head straight up.
Head straight up, looking at your Dada.
Strong girl.
Strong girl, isn't she?
And how are you on that water?
Another day.
I'm coming across mad stuff in this church, eh?
There's, like, things like...
Just things on the walls and everywhere.
Listen to this one.
"Walk in a manner worthy of the calling
with which you have been called.
Peace, power, respect,
dignity, love."
[Owen] What you see is what you get with Conor, there's no filter at all.
translation.ko: 보시는 대로 코너는 거르지 않고 받아들여요

translation.en: It's what makes people love him.
When he does something wrong, he gets the backlash from it,
translation.ko: 잘못된 일을 하면 그로 인한 반발을 사죠

translation.en: but you can't change that, you can't separate the two.
translation.ko: 하지만 바꿀 순 없어요 둘을 분리할 수 없죠

translation.en: He is all-in on everything he does.
[Conor] I've just had the trippiest bleedin' buzz of me life in there with that reverend.
translation.ko: 그 목사님과 함께 최고의 경험을 했어

translation.en: Never experienced anything like that in me life there.
It's just a mad buzz being around people that talk that way.
translation.ko: 사람들이 주위에서 말하는 게 들리는 거야

translation.en: -Yeah. -And just think that way, out loud.
-Constantly pushed to think that way. -Yeah.
-D'you know what I'm saying? -Yeah, yeah.
-Selfless, and all. -Yeah.
I mean, Conor, I remember you saying how bad this was gonna be.
translation.ko: 넌 이게 안 좋을 거라고 했잖아

translation.en: -Look how good it is, though. -Yeah. Yeah.
I'm just delighted, where they've put me.
translation.ko: 이걸 하게 해 줘서 정말 좋아

translation.en: Yeah, quite interesting.
-Uh, do you want to come and sit down? -All right, champion?
-Where you going, baby? -Supermarket, we waited for you.
I heard you were going shoe shopping.
-Shoe shopping? -Yeah, someone said you were.
-Food shopping! -Well, they must've heard "shoe,"
translation.ko: - 음식 사러 간다니까! - 음식을 신발로 헷갈렸군

translation.en: 'cause they come to me and said, "She's going shoe shopping."
[man] Wanna share with us how this week has been for you?
In a chaotic life for me, it's been a welcome escape
translation.ko: 제 혼란스러운 생활에서 탈출한 게 좋았어요

translation.en: to come here, somewhere calm,
and feed off the positive energy of yourself, and the people here.
translation.ko: 이곳의 긍정적 에너지를 받아들일 수 있었어요

translation.en: It made me focus in on the hard work that I have ahead of me
translation.ko: 제 앞에 있을 어려운 일에 집중할 수 있게 됐고

translation.en: and I'm very excited by that.
I appreciate your hospitality. Thank you, thank you.
Very good. [laughs]
This has been... It's kind of a bit sad I have to go, you know what I mean?
I don't gotta go for another couple of days, I can stay!
[John] He has made mistakes. Mistakes that I absolutely don't condone.
translation.ko: 코너는 용납할 수 없는 실수를 저질렀죠

translation.en: I know he regrets them.
He's paid for them, he's trying to learn, trying to move on.
translation.ko: 그래서 그 대가를 치렀고 교훈을 배워서 나아갈 거예요

translation.en: I hope we return to the positive things.
The goal-setting,
the work ethic, and I know Conor does as well.
translation.ko: 직업 윤리를 말이죠 코너는 그렇게 할 겁니다

translation.en: Three, two, one, go!
After my first defeat, I got caught not taking it serious enough.
translation.ko: 〝맥그리거 대 하빕 경기 5개월 후〞 처음 패배한 후 심각하게 받아들이지 않기로 했죠

translation.en: I got caught not taking the mental approach serious enough.
And then I said, I'm going to put everything into this.
translation.ko: 그리고는 여기에 모든 걸 쏟기로 했죠

translation.en: That won't happen to me again.
I won't get caught not fully committed to it.
translation.ko: 전념하지 않을 일은 받아들이지 않을 거예요

translation.en: Slipping, know what I mean?
translation.ko: 미끄러지지 않을 거라고요 무슨 말인지 알죠?

translation.en: You're either in it until death,
translation.ko: 죽을 때까지 최선을 다하지 않을 거면

translation.en: or you're not in it at all.
[man 1] 2018 ended with the UFC's biggest star
being outclassed by Khabib in the Octagon, without a title,
and without a win in over two years.
[man 2] Everyone wants to see Conor fall flat on his face.
Over the past year, he has given us lots of reasons to root against him.
translation.ko: 사람들이 싫어할 일을 최근에 많이 했거든요

translation.en: [man 3] Conor's best days are long gone. They're behind him.
[Ariel] 2018 was hard for him.
A lot of people were wondering, can he get back on track?
translation.ko: 코너가 다시 설 수 있을까 궁금해하는 사람이 많아요

translation.en: Did he have the fire? Did he have the will? Did he get exposed?
translation.ko: 코너에게 열정과 의지가 있고 거기에 노출됐을까?

translation.en: That being said, if there's one thing we've learned from this guy
translation.ko: 〝힘은 어디에서 오는가?〞 하지만 코너의 커리어에서 우리가 알게 된 건

translation.en: over the course of his career, it's to not doubt him.
translation.ko: 하지만 코너의 커리어에서 우리가 알게 된 건 코너를 의심하면 안 된다는 거예요

translation.en: You know, that chip on his shoulder, that motivation,
has always been a driving force for him.
[interviewer] Sounds like you are the last person
that would ever give an excuse why you lost.
Nah, nah, there is no excuse.
I've been beat before.
I've lost MMA fights,
I've lost boxing fights, I've lost so many fights in the gym,
you know, I lose all the time. So, it is what it is.
Any true martial artist will know
in order to succeed at this game, you must lose
translation.ko: 한 경기에서 이기려면 엄청나게 져야 한다는 걸

translation.en: a fucking shitload of times, you know what I mean?
translation.ko: 잘 알고 있어요 무슨 말인지 알죠?

translation.en: You must lose many times, you know what I mean?
I don't bitch and moan.
We all have the same emotions and we have all won and we have all lost.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 같은 감정을 느끼고 이기고 지고 하잖아요

translation.en: It's a sport. It is what it is.
Just get on with it. Look to learn-- Look to learn from it.
The day you stop trying to learn is the day you start losing.
translation.ko: 배우는 걸 멈추면 그때부터 지게 돼요

translation.en: I'm always going to learn, regardless of the result.
translation.ko: 결과와 관계 없이 전 항상 배울 거예요

translation.en: Win or lose, I will take something from it all.
I don't know, feels a bit broke to be honest.
translation.ko: 모르겠어 솔직히 조금 부러진 것 같아

translation.en: [man 1] That's the problem with Conor.
[man 2] This man has not won since November 2016.
Sometimes you gotta go to certain places in life to realize what we need to do.
translation.ko: 해야 할 일을 깨달으려면 어딘가를 가야 할 때도 있죠

translation.en: Let's fucking go!
